Desc.entry: Bookstart is a national gifting project giving free books to babies aged 0-12 months, toddlers aged from 18 months to 2Â½ years and children aged 3. All babies in Sheffield are entitled to a bag with 2 baby board books, information about sharing books with babies (for parents and carers) and a baby library card is available. The toddler pack has 2 books, guidance booklet for adults, chunky crayons, colouring book and home library name plates. For children aged 3 there are Bookstart treasure chests with 2 books, grown up crayons, colouring book, treasure book of ideas and name plates. Baby/toddler packs are available from libraries, some health visitors, pre-schools and Children's Centres. Bookstart treasure chests are distributed via nurseries. Activities and events are held in libraries and nurseries. Sheffield Libraries work with health visitors, childminders and Children's Centres, the Local Education Authority (LEA) and the private sector to deliver Bookstart materials.

Langs.entry: Dual language books available for babies and children up to three years
